title: 103_s210
content: LIMITATION OF COST-OF-LIVING ADJUSTMENTS FOR PAY FOR MEMBERS OF CONGRESS AND CERTAIN SENIOR FEDERAL OFFICIALS. Members of Congress will have their annual pay rates adjusted based on the General Schedule rates under certain conditions. The adjustment will be rounded to the nearest multiple of $100. Members of Congress will have their annual pay rates adjusted based on the General Schedule rates, rounded to the nearest multiple of $100, determined by the percentage change in the ECI or the maximum percentage increase under the Social Security Act for the applicable year. Members of Congress will have their pay rates adjusted based on the General Schedule rates, rounded to the nearest multiple of $100, determined by the percentage change in the ECI or the maximum percentage increase under the Social Security Act for the applicable year. The first adjustment under this section shall become effective in the calendar year beginning on January 1, 1995, and all other adjustments shall take effect every 2 calendar years thereafter. The annual rate of pay for Executive Schedule Officers shall be adjusted every 2 calendar years based on the preceding year's adjustment in the General Schedule rates. The annual rate of pay for Executive Schedule Officers is adjusted every 2 years based on the General Schedule rates. The adjustment is determined by the percentage change in the ECI or the maximum percentage increase under the Social Security Act. The annual rate of pay for Executive Schedule Officers is adjusted every 2 years based on the General Schedule rates. The adjustment is determined by the percentage change in the ECI or the maximum percentage increase under the Social Security Act. The Vice President's salary is determined under section 225 of the Federal Salary Act of 1967. The Vice President's salary in the United States is adjusted based on the percentage change in the ECI every two years, following the Federal Salary Act of 1967. The Vice President's salary in the United States is adjusted every two years based on the percentage change in the ECI or the maximum percentage increase determined under the Social Security Act. The adjustment takes effect on the first day of the fiscal year. Limitation on cost-of-living adjustments for federal annuities for members of Congress and certain senior federal officials. The adjustment for an annuity under the Civil Service Retirement System based on service as a Member or in a position under the Executive Schedule is limited to the lesser of the percentage adjustment under section 8340 or the maximum percentage increase determined under the Social Security Act. The adjustment for an annuity under the Federal Employees' Retirement System based on creditable service as a Member or in a position under the Executive Schedule is limited to the lesser of the percentage adjustment under section 8462 or the maximum percentage increase determined under the Social Security Act. The adjustment for an annuity under the Federal Employees' Retirement System based on creditable service as a Member or in a position under the Executive Schedule is limited to the lesser of the percentage adjustment under section 8462 or the maximum percentage increase determined under the Social Security Act.
